benchmark_details.name: MedOmni-45°: A Safety–Performance Benchmark for Reasoning-Oriented LLMs in Medicine
benchmark_details.overview: A benchmark and evaluation workflow explicitly designed to quantify the safety–performance trade-off in LLMs under manipulative hint conditions, containing 1,804 reasoning-focused medical questions across six clinical specialties and three task types.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To quantify the safety–performance trade-off in reasoning-oriented medical tasks for large language models.

data.source: Self-constructed dataset based on six medical specialties and 500 items from MedMCQA.
data.annotation: Questions are manually verified by medical annotators to ensure accuracy and clinical validity.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model responses to medical questions under various manipulative hint conditions.
methodology.interpretation: Scores across metrics indicate the balance between safety and performance.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against baseline standard medical QA benchmarks.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential safety risks from LLMs exhibiting sycophantic tendencies.
